title: Are Sustainable Practices a Money Suck or Are They Creating Positive Retail Impact? - PYMNTS.com
summary: Sustainable business practices are becoming more common in the retail industry, but it is unclear if they lead to long-term financial benefits. Some companies, like Sephora and H&M, believe that sustainability initiatives can resonate with customers and attract new ones who prioritize sustainability. Other companies, like Selfridges and Hermès, have recently left the Fashion Pact, a coalition of fashion and textile companies committed to reducing the industry's environmental impact, due to slow progress with collective sustainability efforts.

title: Five priorities for sustainable procurement in healthcare - Feature - Philips
summary: Healthcare should focus on greener procurement to help achieve the Paris Agreement and 2050 net-zero targets. European procurers can improve supplier evaluation criteria for Green Public Procurement across five key themes. These themes include: improving supplier reporting of environmental impact and GHG reduction plans; promoting circularity for health technology products and solutions; encouraging supplier transparency on product performance and EcoDesign; requiring suppliers to demonstrate how digital offerings support decarbonization and dematerialization; and encouraging suppliers to publicly report their social impact.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article advocates for greener procurement in healthcare to reduce environmental impact and contribute to sustainability goals like the Paris Agreement.
business_innovation: FALSE - The article does not mention any specific business innovations.
green_product: TRUE - The article encourages the use of health technology products and solutions that promote circularity and reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE - The article suggests implementing green processes that minimize environmental impact, such as those that reduce waste, conserve resources, and limit harmful substance emissions.

title: How to make climate finance work for everyone - World Economic Forum
summary: Climate finance needs to be scaled up and redesigned so that governments, investors and businesses prioritize green solutions. Every day, governments, financial institutions and corporations have a choice to make: invest in physical assets that emit greenhouse gases and harm nature or prioritize the development of green solutions that foster a stable, resilient and equitable economy. Estimates suggest around $5 trillion of capital will be needed every year by 2050 to meet climate and biodiversity goals.
